column4: you might need to add the modules you dont like to /etc/hotplug/blacklist
if you have hardware in your PC, id reccomend you leave it on
??....under ubuntu...is hotplug responsible for loading everything?
pretty sure its a part of the backbone
it loads a lot of nonsense...like vesafb
vesafb is loaded from the usplash. have you disabled that?
under other distros...hotplug is used for things like USB devices, etc.
nope...where is that -- i apologize, I've been a FreeBSD user for years
im pretty sure that hotplug, along with hal, load everything you need
thats sucks...cause I don't need everything :)
are you trying to make an uber-minimal system?
nope, I just don't want useless kernel modules...I don't use the sound on this machine...and I don't care for pretty boot splashes (who reboots?)
well get rid of "usplash" or "splash" in the grub menu (/boot/grub/menu.1st) and disable sound with your bios?
thats a start..what about ipv6?
ahhhhh i did that on my machine... hang on, ill brb.
ok, open up /etc/modprobe.d/aliases
just comment it out?
ok, comment out alias net-pf-10 ipv6
thanks, i'll try to follow the same pattern with the others
ok. but be very careful.
the blacklist if the better way
I think im gonna try the blacklist first :)...thanks for all yer help
no problem!
